_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology conducts research and utilizes pilot plants to develop process technologies used by the refining and petrochemical industry. NAICS 541712



The process at CB&I Technology includes 250-V-271 Propylene storage vessel and propylene tank truck.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES

- Storage vessels are high-pressure construction

- Pressure relieves to flare

- High flow shutoff valves on LPG trailers and isotainers

- Emergency equipment shutdown procedures

- Water fog used to mitigate releases

- Regulator

- guidelines for safe operation (OSHA PSM and EPA RMP)

- Risk management program

- Mechanical integrity program

- Employee training

- Process hazard analyses

- Management of change

- Policies and procedures for safe operation of equipment





DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology conducts research and utilizes pilot plants to develop process technologies used by the refining and petrochemical industry. NAICS 541712



Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology is committed to protection of the health and safety of people in our workplace, the public and the environment. The company believes occupational illnesses, injuries and environmental incidents are preventable, and their occurrence is unacceptable. Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology objective is to continuously improve health, safety and environmental (HSE) performance and be a recognized leader in industry. 



Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology demonstrate an unwavering commitment to the long-term sustainability of our planet, and the health and safety of our employees and partners. This culture strengthens Lummus' business, promotes environmental well-being and benefits our customers, employees, partners and suppliers.



Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology uses a HSE management system to define and manage

risks at the site, and ensure operations are in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The management system has four basic components:

- Identification

- Assessment

- Provision of controls

- Assessment of risks and hazards considers the full life cycle of an activity from beginning to end. 



Hazard Assessment

Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology hazard assessment process : 

- Identifies HSE hazards and potentially adverse effects, and assesses related risks which could arise from existing or proposed activities which could potentially affect the:

  o Health and safety of employees, contractors or the public

  o Environment, including soil and groundwater contamination

  o Company's reputation, liabilities or profitability

  o Company's assets

- Uses risk assessment methodologies, including scenarios and consequences/probability ratings (Risk Assessment Matrix) appropriate for the hazard, effect and associated risk(s) being considered.

- Applies, as a function of the risk level, appropriate controls to prevent, or reduce likelihood of, occurrence, and applies appropriate recovery measures to reduce the possible effects of HSE risks

- Assures measures for risk control and recovery are adequate and clearly linked to related tasks/activities (competence/responsibility) assigned to specific individuals in the organization

- Manages changes to facilities, processes, operations and other activities to assure hazards, effects and risks are reassessed and plans for HSE event prevention, control and recovery are updated accordingly

- Applies Product Stewardship as part of a HSE effort that manages hazards and effects during all phases of the life cycle of our products.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology has had no reportable releases of flammable substances in the past five years.





EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology emergency response progra

m is comprehensive, providing:

- public notification through the CAER Line

- emergency medical treatment through arrangements with local clinics and hospitals

- emergency response procedures 

- plan coordination with the community through the Southeast Regional LEPC

- prompt response to requests for additional information from local officials



Chemical Research & Licensing / Lummus Technology plan is regularly evaluated and updated as needed. All alarms are audible and can be automatically or manually activated. Personnel are trained to isolate the point of release, coordinate response activities with third party responders and activate the CAER line as necessary.



Emergency response systems include:



- Audible alarm systems for notification of personnel and neighboring facilities, including paging horns, fire alarms, and high and low gas detection alarms.

- Mobile fire protection equipment (portable 20 pound and wheeled 50 pound fire extinguishers)

- Water fog capability for minimization of the effect of releases by knocking down vapors and cooling tanks

- Communication link to off-site responders

- CAER Line system to notify public and neighboring facilities of emergencies and actions to be taken.
